title: Remakes in Ranked
body: Ever since remake has been introduced, this has bothered me. We sit and spend 10+ minutes starting a ranked game and getting in game. Putting ourselves in the mindset for ranked. Then the enemy team remakes and neither team gets anything for the waste of their time. I understand that the "losing" team gets nothing because they technically don't get a loss so they don't lose LP. But the "winning" team should get like 2 LP for the waste of their time. They weren't the ones who remade. A remake is technically taking a win away from them. At least give them 2 LP for the waste of their time. It isn't fair to them to have a winning game remade and then get absolutely nothing for it.

replies.body: Y'know, I don't personally think this would be a terrible idea, but I could also see some people abusing it as well. Players could get in a game and then decide who they wanted to remake, allowing one team an easy lump of LP while the other team gets off without any type of penalty for abusing the system. It'd be worth the time to post this on the [**gameplay board**](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance) to see what the community thinks as well.

I do agree with the abusing it, but that's where I also believe, which I'm not sure if they do, that the people who leave be punished with a regular loss. Either intentional or not, they did leave a ranked game and should have some sort of punishment. But I do agree with you that it could be abused, that's why I suggest a low amount like 2. That way its not worth it to remake intentionally since normally you would get around 15+
